Annotation.String: IETF NETMOD (NETCONF Data Modeling Language) Working Group

WG Web: <http://tools.ietf.org/wg/netmod/> WG List: <mailto:netmod@ietf.org> WG Chair: Thomas Nadeau <mailto:tnadeau@lucidvision.com> WG Chair: Juergen Schoenwaelder <mailto:j.schoenwaelder@jacobs-university.de> Editor: Martin Bjorklund <mailto:mbj@tail-f.com>

This module contains a collection of YANG definitions for managing network interfaces. Copyright (c) 2014 IETF Trust and the persons identified as authors of the code. All rights reserved. Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification, is permitted pursuant to, and subject to the license terms contained in, the Simplified BSD License set forth in Section 4.c of the IETF Trust's Legal Provisions Relating to IETF Documents (http://trustee.ietf.org/license-info). This version of this YANG module is part of RFC 7223; see the RFC itself for full legal notices.
RFC 7223: A YANG Data Model for Interface Management
This type is used by data models that need to reference configured interfaces.
This type is used by data models that need to reference the operationally present interfaces.
Base identity from which specific interface types are derived.
This feature indicates that the device allows user-controlled interfaces to be named arbitrarily.

This feature indicates that the device supports pre-provisioning of interface configuration, i.e., it is possible to configure an interface whose physical interface hardware is not present on the device.
This feature indicates that the device implements the IF-MIB.
Navigation property that points to a resource of interfaces.
Navigation property that points to a resource of interfaces_state.
A extension of ietf_interfaces resource instances.
